E.buttonTextP2P01_1:
Explanation of Classification:

01 - Target process without PR: The target process avoids the creation of purchase requisition
E.buttonTextP2P01_2: 02 - No Order Acknowledgment Requirement: An order confirmation is not required for these purchase order items
E.buttonTextP2P01_3:
03 - Small purchase amount: The net order value is less than 100 €

09 - Others
E.buttonTextP2P02_1: 01 - Dummy values: The old or new net order value is 0 or 1
E.buttonTextP2P02_2: 02 - Multiple price changes: Purchase order items with at least 2 price changes
E.buttonTextP2P02_3: 03 - Price change after Goods Receipt: The net order value was changed after goods receipt
E.buttonTextP2P02_4: 04 - Large price changes: Price changes of more than 20%
E.buttonTextP2P02_5: 05 - Small price changes: Price changes of less than 5%
E.buttonTextP2P04_2: 01 - Short delivery period: The planned delivery time is less than 3 days
E.buttonTextP2P04_3: 02 - No Order Acknowledgment Requirement: An order confirmation is not required for these purchase order items
E.buttonTextP2P05_2: 01 - Without Due Date: No Due Date set.
E.buttonTextP2P05_3: 02a - No Goods Receipt and Due Date Passed: There is not yet a Goods Receipt booked and the due date already passed.
E.buttonTextP2P05_4: 02b - No Goods Receipt and Future Due Date: There is not yet a Goods Receipt booked, however the due date is to come.
E.buttonTextP2P05_5: 03a - Delivery on time: A delivery for the PO item happened on time, thus within the set delivery buffer
E.buttonTextP2P05_5b: 03b - Delivery within Time Frame but no full Delivery: A delivery for the PO item happened on time but the quantity was less than ordered
E.buttonTextP2P05_6: 04a - Delivery too late: The delivery for the PO item happened after the due date
E.buttonTextP2P05_7: 04b - Delivery too late and Short Notice PO: A delivery for the PO item happened more than three days after the due date.
E.buttonTextP2P05_8: However, between Creation of PO and Due Date have been less than 7 days.
E.buttonTextP2P05_9: 05 - Delivery too early: A delivery for the PO item happened more than three days before the due date

E.how1: Select ONE of the companies having a high RPA Indicator. This means that they have already a relatively standardized process, but still a large part of this process is performed manually.
E.how11: In the next sheet, only Purchase Orders (POs) from the selected company will be used when analyzing the purchasing process for frequent manual activities.
E.how2: Select activities having a high number of manual activities and filter on it. By this, only POs going through this selected activity are part of the further analysis.
E.how3: Choose  the activity selected in the previous sheet in the drop-down to see all predecessors (sources) of this activity.
E.how33: This chart shows all existing ingoing process flows to the selected activity. This helps to get an impression about the degree of standardization for this process step and to identify frequent process variants that are interesting for a RPA solution.
E.how333: Many rows (=different process flows) could indicate that the process is not very standardized and the root causes need to be investigated in greater detail before using RPA.
E.how3333: Process flows from process start to the selected activity are not separatly shown in the visualizations.
E.how33333: Filter on the desired process flow(s) having a high saving potential to fine-tune the selected process flow on the next sheet.
E.how4: In this sheet, you can get an detailed overview where to start and where to focus on.
E.how44: For instance, if you want to start small with a certain vendor or document type, you can filter on those and see the effects.

E.infoCostValue: If the ratio is greater than 100%, the manual process costs exceed the net order value. The ratio should be kept as low as possible.
E.InfoInFullDelivery: In Full Delivery: A delivery is considered as complete, when the aggregated quantity of all goods receipts matches the quantity specified in the purchase order.

E.InfoQuantityToleranceInFull: Tolerance buffer: Define underdelivery and overdelivery tolerance values (%), which are used for the identification of ‚In Full Deliveries‘.
E.InfoRequestedDeliveryDate: The requested delivery date is the date requested by the ordering company in the order.
E.InfoShortNoticeCreation: Short notice creation: Purchase orders, for which goods receipt took place not later than 24 hours, are defined as short notice .
E.InfoSoDItemsNumber1: Be aware that the number of Purchase Oder Items, Net Order Value, #POs with violation of SODs and Violated SOD ratio are calculated
E.InfoSoDItemsNumber2: based on your two selected activities. It does not display the whole set of cases in your Purchase-to-Pay Process.
E.InfoStatisticalDeliveryDate: The statistical delivery date is a statistically calculated date based on previous order to evaluate the supplier.
E.InfoUnderOverDeliverySystem: You can also select the 'Over/Underdelivery tolerance (System)' options, which use the PO item specific tolerance defined in your ERP system.
E.InfoUnlimitedOverdelivery: Unlimited Overdelivery: If the ‚Unlimited Overdelivery Allowed‘-Indicator (technical: „EKPO“.“UEBTK“ ) is set to ‚X‘, overdelivery is ignored for the calculation of this KPI.

E.OverallSavingsPotentialExplanation: These KPIs show the overall savings potential when considering all manual activities
E.P2PATextAnalysis: How high are automation rates of individual process activities? Can they be improved further?
E.P2PATextBenefit: Increasing the automation rates of certain process activities improves the efficiency of the procurement process by streamlining and reducing recurring manual interactions.
E.P2PATextCalculation: Financial Impact = [target automation rate (%) - base phase automation rate (%)] * base phase frequency of activity (#) * time saving through automation (min)  * FTE costs (<%=Currency%>/min) * time factor (x)
E.P2PATextCalculation1: Value To Date = [impact phase automation rate (%) - base phase automation rate (%)] * impact phase frequency of activity (#) * time saving through automation (min)  * FTE costs (<%=Currency%>/min) * time factor (x)
E.P2PATextGeneral1: This analysis aims at showing the (financial) impact of measures to increase the automation rate of activities over time.
E.P2PATextGeneral2: With the analysis you can calculate the potential financial impact of measures for up to eight activities in the Base Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measures are not yet in place.
E.P2PATextGeneral3: Moreover, you can compare the potential financial impact of the Base Phase to the realized value-to-date of the measures in the Impact Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measure is in place.
E.P2PATextGeneral4: This way, you can track the effectiveness of measures to increase the automation of activities over time.
E.P2PATextInfo1: The percentage of NULL user types gives us an idea of how accurate the automation rate of this activity is. Null values are excluded in all calculations of the formulas in this sheet
E.P2PATextInfo2: (this can also be the reason why the automation rate slightly varies in comparison to the explorative view). Therefore, the calculated values gain accuracy with a dropping NULL user type ratio.
E.P2PATextScaling2: You can also incorporate other factors in this number. For calculation reason please also define automatic user types.
E.P2PATextTarget: Please select the target threshold of your analysis. Please also define the lelngths of the phases.
E.P2PCUTextAnalysis: Contract usage: Increase the use of contracts with your most important suppliers to ensure an efficient procurement process.
E.P2PCUTextBenefit: With the use of contracts the purchasing department can increase the predictability of prices and ensure a constant price discount.
E.P2PCUTextCalculation: Financial impact = [target contract usage ratio (%) - current contract usage ratio (%)] * affected purchase order volume (currency) * discount potential (%) * realization potential (%)
E.P2PCUTextCalculation1: Value to date = [Impact phase contract usage ratio (%) - Base phase contract usage ratio (%)] * Impact phase affected purchase order volume (currency) * discount potential (%)
E.P2PCUTextGeneral1: This analysis aims at showing the (financial) impact of measures to increase contract usage.
E.P2PCUTextGeneral2: With the analysis you can calculate the potential financial impact of such measures, i.e. the time interval in which the measures are not yet in place.
E.P2PCUTextGeneral3: Moreover, you can compare the potential financial impact of the Base Phase to the realized value-to-date of the measures in the Impact Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measure is in place.
E.P2PCUTextGeneral4: This way, you can track the effectiveness of measures over time.
E.P2PCUTextHeading: Value Evaluation for Measures increasing Contract Usage
E.P2PCUTextScaling1: Define the scaling factor that lets you compare Base Phase and Impact Phase no matter of differences in interval length, total order quantity or total order net value.
E.P2Pdummyvaluesinfo: Dummy values: The net order value is 0 or 1.
E.P2PETextAnalysis: EDI: How many orders are processed using electronic data interchange? What potential is untapped?
E.P2PETextBenefit: Identify suppliers with high transactional volume but low e-business rate and heavily reduce throughput times caused by manual efforts in the process.
E.P2PETextCalculation: Financial Impact = [target EDI ratio (%) - base phase EDI ratio (%)] * number of purchase orders base phase (#) * time savings per purchase order when processed via EDI (min) * FTE costs (<%=Currency%>/min) * time factor (x)
E.P2PETextCalculation1: Value To Date = [impact phase EDI ratio (%) - base phase EDI ratio (%)] * number of purchase orders impact phase (#) * time savings per purchase order when processed via EDI (min) * FTE costs (<%=Currency%>/min) * time factor (x)
E.P2PETextGeneral1: This analysis aims at showing the (financial) impact of measures to increase the orders with EDI over time.
E.P2PETextGeneral2: With the analysis you can calculate the potential financial impact of measures to increase the EDI in the Base Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measures are not yet in place.
E.P2PETextGeneral3: Moreover, you can compare the potential financial impact of the Base Phase to the realized value-to-date of the measures in the Impact Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measure is in place.
E.P2PETextGeneral4: This way, you can track the effectiveness of measures to increase the orders with EDI over time.
E.P2PETextScaling2: You can also incorporate other factors in this number. For calculation reason please also define the acceptable transmission media.
E.P2PETextTarget: Please select the target threshold of your analysis. Please also define the lengths of the phases.
E.P2PMATextAnalysis: Manual changes: How often do manual change, block or rework activities occur in the procurement process?
E.P2PMATextBenefit: Manual activities slow down the process significantly and introduce a doubling in cost per manual activity. Identifying and reducing those manual activities reduces associated FTE cost.
E.P2PMATextCalculation: Financial impact = Manual change activities (#) * invested effort per manual change (min) * FTE costs (currency/min) * realization potential (%) * time factor (x)
E.P2PMATextCalculation1: Value-to-date = (Quantity of activity [Base Phase, scaled] / Quantity of activity [Impact Phase]) * FTE costs (currency/min)  * time factor (x)
E.P2PMATextDataset: Shows (filtered) start and end date of the dataset.
E.P2PMATextDateSelection: Select start and end date of the considered dataset. It makes most sense to use the start and end dates from the left. Also select the cut-off date that separates the dataset into Base Phase and Impact Phase.
E.P2PMATextEmployee: Used to transfer time savings in monetary values.
E.P2PMATextGeneral1: This analysis aims at showing the (financial) impact of measures to reduce manual activities over time.
E.P2PMATextGeneral2: With the analysis you can calculate the potential financial impact of up to 10
E.P2PMATextGeneral3: measures to reduce manual activities in the Base Phase, i.e. the time interval where the measures are not yet in place.
E.P2PMATextGeneral4: Moreover, you can compare the potential financial impact of the Base Phase to the achieved value-to-date of the measures in the Impact Phase,  i.e. the time interval where the measure is in place.
E.P2PMATextGeneral5: This way, you can track the effectiveness of measures to reduce manual activities over time.
E.P2PMATextHeading: Value Evaluation for Manual Change, Block and Rework Activities
E.P2PMATextScaling1: Define the scaling factor that lets you compare Base Phase and Impact Phase no matter of differences in interval length or total order quantity.
E.P2PMATextScaling2: You can also incorporate other factors in this number. For calculation reason please also define manual user types.
E.P2PMATextTarget: Please select the target threshold of your analysis. The proposed value is the monthly average of the financial impact, but you can choose any other value. Please also define the length of the phases.
E.P2PMBTextAnalysis: Maverick Buying: Where do we spot process patterns that imply procurement without involvement of the purchasing department?
E.P2PMBTextBenefit: The involvement of a dedicated purchasing department for purchase orders leads to significant savings through optimized purchasing terms, applicable discounts and higher standardization.
E.P2PMBTextCalculation: Financial impact = Maverick buying purchase order volume (currency) * discount potential when purchasing department included (%) * realization potential (%)
E.P2PMBTextCalculation1: Value to Date = [Base Maverick buying purchase order volume (currency) -  Impact Phase Maverick buying purchase order volume (currency)] * discount potential when purchasing department included (%)
E.P2PMBTextGeneral1: This analysis aims at showing the (financial) impact of measures to reduce purchases involved in maverick buying.
E.P2PMBTextGeneral2: With the analysis you can calculate the potential financial impact of such measures, i.e. the time interval in which the measures are not yet in place.
E.P2PMBTextGeneral3: Moreover, you can compare the potential financial impact of the Base Phase to the realized value-to-date of the measures in the Impact Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measure is in place.
E.P2PMBTextGeneral4: This way, you can track the effectiveness of measures over time.
E.P2PMBTextHeading: Value Evaluation for Measures reducing Maverick Buying
E.P2PMBTextTarget: Please select the target threshold of your analysis.
E.P2POTDETextAnalysis: On time delivery (early): Using machine learning, we can reduce deliveries arriving too early to be delivered just in time.
E.P2POTDETextBenefit: Reduce early deliveries to save storage costs and reduce working capital from early payments.
E.P2POTDETextCalculation: Working capital: Affected purchase order volume (currency) * ROIC (%) * [affected days]/365 (x) * realization potential (%)
E.P2POTDETextCalculation1: Storage cost: Affected inventory volume (currency) * carrying cost of inventory (%) * [affected days]/365 (x) * realization potential (%)
E.P2POTDLTextAnalysis: On time delivery (late): Using machine learning, we can reduce deliveries arriving too late to be delivered just in time.
E.P2POTDLTextBenefit: Reduce late deliveries to decrease downtime in your subsequent supply chain, save inventory costs and reduce working capital associated with your safety stock.
E.P2POTDLTextCalculation: Safety stock - working capital: Safety stock ratio (%) * affected safety stock volume (currency) * ROIC (%) * [affected days]/365 (x) * realization potential (%)
E.P2POTDLTextCalculation1: Safety stock - storage cost: Safety stock ratio (%) * affected safety stock volume (currency) * carrying cost of inventory (%) * [affected days]/365 (x) * realization potential (%)
E.P2POTDTextGeneral1: This analysis aims at showing the (financial) impact of measures to improve the on-time delivery of goods.
E.P2POTDTextGeneral2: With the analysis you can calculate the potential financial impact of such measures, i.e. the time interval in which the measures are not yet in place.
E.P2POTDTextGeneral3: Moreover, you can compare the potential financial impact of the Base Phase to the realized value-to-date of the measures in the Impact Phase, i.e. the time interval in which the measure is in place.
E.P2POTDTextGeneral4: This way, you can track the effectiveness of measures over time.
E.P2POTDTextScaling1: Define the ROIC for your company.
E.P2POTDTextTarget: Please select the target thresholds for early and late delivery rate of your analysis. The proposed values are the averages of the base phase, but you can choose any other value. Please also define the scaling factor.
E.P2POTextHeading: Value evaluation for measures improving on-time delivery

E.why1: Not every company is suitable for applying RPA solutions. This can have different reasons such as having an unstandardized process or already an efficient back-end solution in place.
E.why2: Automating frequently occurring process steps has the largest impact on your process efficiency and process costs.
E.why22: Thereby, manual activities that cannot be automated by an back-end solution, e.g. batch job, are particularly interesting for being speeded up by using an RPA solution.
E.why3: Having found frequent manual activities, search for process flows that have little variations meaning that many cases go the same way process flow. This guarantees a simple and profitable setup of the RPA implementation.
E.why4: Making the potential savings tangible by these numbers helps to understand the business value of RPA implementations. Thereby, focusing on certain kind of purchase orders can simplify the implementation of bots in the beginning.
E.why44: The 'Total Savings Potential' shows an estimation how much costs and effort can be saved when automating all manual activities considering all filters (e.g. company code, process flow, etc.) and the selected automation potential.
E.withoutinteraction: PO Items without any manual interaction

E.AnalysisP2P02ChallengeHeading: Why is a reduce of price changes so important?
E.AnalysisP2P02ChallengeText1: Price changes in the company slow down the business efficiency as they are typical rework activities. At the same time, the significant manual effort involved in changing prices also significantly increases process costs.
E.AnalysisP2P02ChallengeText2: Therefore it is in every company‘s best interest that the direction of improvement is to minimize the price change ratio as much as possible.
E.AnalysisP2P02ChallengeText3: Let us get started to analyze Price Changes and how to improve them within this analysis
E.AnalysisP2P02PriceChangeText: of your Purchase Order items are changed in Price until completed.
E.AnalysisP2P02OptimizationPotential: are lost by doing these rework activities in your procurement process.
E.AnalysisP2P02Heading: Reduce Occurrence of Price Changes in Purchasing
E.AnalysisP2P02KPIText1: The price change ratio can be calculated as follows:
E.AnalysisP2P02PotentialSmallText1: *Our experience shows that a reduction of "Change Price" activities is possible! Possible taking actions to reduce the amount of "Change Price" activities are shown in this analysis.
E.AnalysisP2P02PotentialText1: To provide you with an easy-to-use quantification of the business potential, we use a full-time equivalent (FTE) based calculation that examines the number of manual price changes
E.AnalysisP2P02PotentialText2: , the time per change and the resulting cost impact.
E.AnalysisP2P02RootCauseClassDefinition1: Price changes are classified in this category if dummy values were set and forgotten to be changed after.  This means the old or the new value take on the number 0.00 or 1.00.
E.AnalysisP2P02RootCauseClassDefinition2: Multiple price changes are defined by 2 or more price changes for a purchase order item.
E.AnalysisP2P02RootCauseClassDefinition3: The price has been changed either at the same time or after the ordered goods have been received.
E.AnalysisP2P02RootCauseClassDefinition4: Price changes that are equal or larger than a factor 2.
E.AnalysisP2P02RootCauseClassDefinition5: Price changes that are equal or smaller than a factor 2.

E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionImplementation1: Check whether these materials are a special order, e.g. ordered only once, or whether it makes sense to assign a new material number.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionImplementation2: Contact the responsible purchasers and compare the list of the alternative processes you have identified and verify whether the purchasing information records are still up-to-date.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionImplementation3: One way to minimize manual price changes is to define the condition for an overall exchange rate of metal in the purchasing information record.  These rates can be adjusted daily but this adjustment does not take place for each individual purchasing
information record.  The rates adapt to the new values for all purchasing information records in the corresponding validity period.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionImplementation4: Use collective invoices for the occurring transport costs in intervals , e.g. 1x per month.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionMeasure2: Set or adjust purchasing information records
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionMeasure3: Minimize manual price changes for metal and similar substances
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionObjective1: Differentiate between special orders and orders with missing material numbers.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionObjective2: Prevent one of the root causes for price changes, which is that there is wrong data in the purchasing information records.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionObjective3: Cost reduction by linking the purchasing information records to exchange rates.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionObjective4: Reduce the amount of price changes which are related to expected and actual transport costs.
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionQuestion: What are useful measures to decrease Price Changes?
E.AnalysisP2P02TakingActionText1: Here you can add trends overtime or benchmarks to see the results over a period of time.
E.InfoUnderFullMatchRatio: Percentage of cases with matching quantity in purchase order, goods receipt and invoice and matching price per unit in purchase order and invoice.
E.AnalysisP2P20ChallengeText0: The term Three-Way match refers to the comparison of the quantities and price per unit on three different documents in the Purchase-to-Pay Process.
E.AnalysisP2P20ChallengeText1: The purpose is to avoid receiving too low number of goods or paying an incorrect invoice amount.
E.AnalysisP2P20ChallengeText2: This analysis helps understand the need to maximize the rate of Three-Way matches for minimizing the risk of fraudulent behavior or accidental payments.
E.AnalysisP2P20TakingActionQuestion: What are the useful measures to improve Three-Way Match Ratio ?
E.AnalysisP2P20TakingActionObjective1: Ensure that your managers check the Three-Way Match
E.AnalysisP2P20TakingActionImplementation1: Create a guideline showing the different steps of purchase orders and how to check the Three-Way match in the system before further processing invoices
Use the segregation of duty principle in your accounting process. This reduces mistakes in a process.
E.AnalysisP2P20TakingActionImplementation2: Organize brief training sessions by offering several appointments to your employees.
In these sessions, demonstrate how to implement controls in order to avoid differences in the three documents.
E.AnalysisP2P20TakingActionImplementation3: Use Celonis to continuously identify Three-Way Match Ratios and send out automated reports to all managers on a monthly basis with the help of Celonis Stories.
E.AnalysisP2P26Heading: Reduce Occurrence of Quantity Changes in Purchasing
E.AnalysisP2P26ChallengeHeading: Why is reducing quantity changes so important?
E.AnalysisP2P26ChallengeText1: Quantitiy changes can occur before the goods receipt, e.g. due to incorrect entry in the purchase order, or also after goods receipt, and for instance, due to frequently occurring over-runs.
E.AnalysisP2P26ChallengeText2: The problem with quantity changes in the purchasing process is that they not only slow down the purchasing process as they are typical rework activities. At the same time, the significant manual effort involved in changing
E.AnalysisP2P26ChallengeText3: quantities also significantly increases process costs. Therefore, it is in every company‘s best interest to focus on reducing the ratio of orders with quantity changes as much as possible.
E.AnalysisP2P26PotentialSmallText1: *Our experience shows that a reduction of "Quantity Changes" activities is possible! Possible taking actions to reduce the amount of "Quantity Change" activities are shown in this analysis.

E.AnalysisP2P26TakingActionObjective4: Reduce the amount of quantity changes after goods receive which lead to extra transport costs.

E.AnalysisP2P15Heading: Reduce the ocurrence of Deleted Purchase Order Items
E.AnalysisP2P15PotentialSmallText1: *Our experience shows that a reduction of "Delete Purchase Order Item" activities is possible! Possible taking actions to reduce the amount of "Delete Purchase Order Item" activities are shown in this analysis.
E.AnalysisP2P15ChallengeText1: Deleted Purchase Order Items create additional and unnecessary effort for the purchasing department. Deleting a purchase order is an undesired activity that should be reduced to a minimum and only used exceptionally.
E.AnalysisP2P15ChallengeText2: A deleted purchase Order indicates a far higher amount of rework than simple price changes or quantity changes. The reason for this is, that the work for an entire Purchase Order Item is in vain, if the Purchase Order is deleted at some point in time.
E.AnalysisP2P15ChallengeText3: That means of course, that if a purchase order actually has to be deleted, the earlier the better!
E.AnalysisP2P15ChallengeHeading: Why is reducing the amount of deleted purchase order items so important?
E.P2P15Text1: * This sheet is specially filtered to show only activities with deleted PO items
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionQuestion: What are useful measures to eliminate deleted PO Items?
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionObjective1: Reduce the occurance of wrong inputs (e.g. wrong transaction type, wrong quantity) when the PO was originally created
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionImplementation1: Check the "Root Cause" sheet and find out which material or purchase doc. type were shortly being deleted (within 1 day)
after the PO items were being created. Those wrongly entered PO items should be decreased utmost
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionMeasure2: Reduce chances of cancel goods receipt
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionObjective2: Delete PO items have a high possibility to happen after cancel goods receipt. The reason could be that the requestor no longer needs the material/service.
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionImplementation2: Requestor should double check whether the material/service is still needed before create PO items.
If its in the case of wrong goods receipt, the firm should find out reason that causes the wrong orders.
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionObjective3: Price and quantity changes tend to result in delete PO items. This situation should be eliminated, especially for the standard PO.
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionImplementation3: Find out the reason why the price and quantity of PO items, especially the standard PO, were being changed and causing the delete of PO items
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionObjective4: Time reduction of delete PO items manually
E.AnalysisP2P15TakingActionImplementation4: If delete PO item is inevitable, minimizing the degree of manual processing
E.AnalysisP2P15PotentialText1: To provide you with an easy-to-use quantification of the business potential, we use a full-time equivalent (FTE) based calculation that examines the number of manual deleted PO items

E.AnalysisP2P05ChallengeHeading: Why is on-time delivery so important?
E.AnalysisP2P05ChallengeText1: On-time delivery is defined as the delivery of goods by the supplier within a defined tolerance time for the delivery, typically 3 days before the due date up to the due date itself.
E.AnalysisP2P05ChallengeText2: On-time delivery is vital in today’s world of business for several reasons. First, for most companies, the internal production planning and scheduling is dependent on the reliability of timely deliveries by the supplier.
E.AnalysisP2P05ChallengeText3: The worst-case scenario is a production downtime, which are very costly and have the consequence that the company is not able to meet customer demands in the subsequent supply chain and order-to-cash process.
E.AnalysisP2P05Heading: Improve your On-Time Delivery Rates in the Purchase-to-Pay Process
E.AnalysisP2P05KPIText1: Here you can include information about your main KPIs.
E.AnalysisP2P05PotentialSmallText1: Business Potential estimated by Net Working Capital Loss.
E.AnalysisP2P05PotentialText1: Here you can write information about potential savings
E.AnalysisP2P05PotentialText2: Here you can write detailed information about potential savings
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseClassDefinition1: A delivery is generally classified in this category if it arrives one or more days after the confirmed due date.
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseClassDefinition2: A delivery is generally classified in this category if it arrives more than three days before due date.
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseClassDefinition3: A delivery is classified in this category if no delivery has followed even though an order was made. For this category, there is no activity “goods receipt”, however, the due date has already passed.
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseClassDefinition4: In contrast to “No goods receipt and passed due date”, the classification “No goods receipt and future due date” means that no goods were received yet, but the due date has not passed and therefore the delivery is not “too late” yet.
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseHeading1: Detect the rootcauses in your data:
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseQuestion: Why aren’t deliveries on time in the purchase-to-pay process?
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseReasonsText1: Here you can include information about reasons generating the main issues in the process.
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseReasonsTitle: Possible reasons generating problem root causes
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseText1: The root causes for a low On-Time-Delivery Ratio can be classified as follows.
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseText2: Set the data of data extract or Today()
E.AnalysisP2P05RootCauseTitle: Classifications for delivery status of Purchase Order Items:
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionImplementation1: Make sure that every site has easy access for booking goods receipts into the enterprise system. Train personnel and make sure every site adheres to booking goods receipts on the same day the goods arrive.
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionImplementation2: Contact suppliers you have identified in the analysis and point out your definition of On-Time Delivery and that you expect an improvement.
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionImplementation3: Contractually agree to a penalty system with consistently late suppliers. Track On-Time-Delivery KPIs and if the respective suppliers fail to uphold due delivery dates, they will have to pay a penalty charge.
This charge is typically determined as an amount in % of the invoice. In case penalty charges already exist in your company, consider increasing the amount of the charges for these specific vendors.
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionImplementation4: Contact the appropriate department with a list of deleted PO items, as the system takes these into account as “late” deliveries, thereby distorting the results of the On-Time Delivery rate. Delete these in order to improve your calculation ratios.
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionMeasure1: Enable all sites to book a goods receipt
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionObjective1: Ensure proper on time delivery rate calculation
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionObjective2: Increase the supplier’s awareness for on time delivery
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionObjective3: Increase the supplier’s motivation to increase on time delivery
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionObjective4: Improve the On Time Delivery rate calculation
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionQuestion: What are useful measures to increase/decrease ANALYSIS NAME?
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionText1: Here you can add trends overtime or benchmarks to see the results over a period of time.
E.AnalysisP2P05TakingActionTitle: What are useful measures to increase on-time delivery?
E.AnalysisP2P05OptimationPotential1: On-time delivery is vital because the internal production planning and scheduling is dependent on the reliability of suppliers. In the worst-case scenario, the production has a downtime caused by a supplier’s delivery delay with costly consequences.
E.AnalysisP2P05OptimationPotential2: The “Late Purchase Order” analysis aditional can help increase on-time delivery and identify late vendors and late materials.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLChallengeText1: Businesses always look for cutting-edge techniques to make their processes more efficient in order to save costs, reduce wastes, and improve productivity.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLChallengeText2: One can make the Purchase to Pay process more efficient by detecting a potential undesired activity like "Change Price" in advance. Assume that there are 37,000 cases with "Change Price" activities at a company yearly
E.AnalysisP2P02MLChallengeText3: and each "Change Price" activity could take 20 minutes (there is no standard, as this number varies from company to company) to interpret and to take proper actions by an employee.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLChallengeText4: This takes 20*37,000 = 740,000 minutes of company's time equal to 70 months of a single employee working on a full-time basis.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLChallengeText5: With this add-on, it is possible to monitor and to track ongoing business cases and to identify potential cases which will have "Change Price" activity in future.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLHeading: Price Change Prediction using Machine Learning
E.AnalysisP2P02MLPotentialText1: With this add-on, it is possible to predict this undesired behavior and to take proper actions.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLPotentialText3: save costs, speed up the business process, boost efficiency (avoid massive rework and process redesign), improve quality (increase bilateral satisfaction and reduce incidents),
E.AnalysisP2P02MLPotentialText4: affect the cash flow and revenue forecast, monitor important business process cases (i.e. high value ones)
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText1: Applying several Machine Learning algorithms, this add-on predicts the occurrence of Change Price activities in ongoing business cases based on stored information in the provided event-log and case-log of completed cases.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText2: As most of the business cases do not have a Change Price activity, the dataset is "imbalanced". The evaluation metric accuracy is therefore not applicable to this problem.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText3: This is why this add-on uses the "area under the receiver operating characteristic curve" (AUC ROC) as its evaluation metric.
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText4: For example, when predicting Change Price activities at the first process step, e.g. Create Purchase Requisiton, we can test the performance of our model as follows. This dataset has
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText7: of them do not). Our prediction model predicts
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText8: cases to not have change price and
E.AnalysisP2P02MLDChallengeText9: cases to have change price which is correct, but it predicts

E.AnalysisP2P40ChallengeHeading: Why is the segregation of duties so important?
E.AnalysisP2P40ChallengeText1: The term “segregation of duties” is used when more than one person is necessary to complete and fulfill an activity or task.
E.AnalysisP2P40ChallengeText2: It decreases the power one individual person has. For example, the person who requests the purchase of goods should not be the person who approves the purchase as well.
E.AnalysisP2P40ChallengeText3: The segregation provides a barricade to fraud as it would demand a collusion with another person to perform a fraudulent act.
E.AnalysisP2P40ChallengeText4: In other words, the segregation of duties decreases the risk of potential fraud automatically. It is essential for an effective internal control. And therefore, it is important to audit your processes and to review if a separation of duties is ensured.
E.AnalysisP2P40Heading: Spot fraud and errors in internal control by monitoring Segregation of Duties
E.AnalysisP2P40KPIText1: The violated SOD Ratio of the two selected activities is calculated by dividing the PO items with violation of SOD by the number of total purchase order items of the two selected activities.
E.AnalysisP2P40PotentialSmallText1: *Our experience shows that an improvement of the segregation of duties is possible! Possible taking actions to improve the segregation of duties are shown in the sheet "Taking Action".
E.AnalysisP2P40PotentialText1: The strength of SOD controls relies in the fact that there are at least three different individuals involved in every transaction.
E.AnalysisP2P40PotentialText2: When considering if the processes are properly segregated, the key parts to consider are custody, authorization and record keeping.

E.AnalysisP2P40TakingActionImplementation2: Create a documentation in accordance with your company standards.
Make the guidelines available for daily work. Every employee has to know exactly what she/he is doing and also what she/he is not allowed to do.
Determine an owner for the document, who will make it available to new employees.
E.AnalysisP2P40TakingActionImplementation3: Audit your previous processes and identify purchases without a segregation of duties.
Define the reasons for the suspicious processes and identify any fraudulent conduct.
Give training sessions to avoid any future mistakes.
E.AnalysisP2P40TakingActionImplementation4: Perform the Process Mining analysis frequently.
Compare your results easily with previous audits and find out if you’re improved.

E.AnalysisP2P06ChallengeHeading: Why Is Improve Automation Rate So Important?
E.AnalysisP2P06ChallengeText1: Automation of activities has many advantages over manual execution. Company with high automation rate could benefit from time and cost saving as well as faster
E.AnalysisP2P06ChallengeText2: processing and reduce of manual entry errors. To take an Example, in the purchasing department of a company, a higher automation rate in the process of creating
E.AnalysisP2P06ChallengeText3: and approving purchase requests could significantly reduce inefficiency and manual work.

E.AnalysisP2P14Heading: What do free-text orders in the purchase-to-pay process mean?
E.AnalysisP2P14ChallengeText1: Free-text orders are defined as orders without purchase requisitions, material number and contract usage and therefore do not take advantage of economies of scale or contract usage.
E.AnalysisP2P14ChallengeText2: As a consequence, costs for free-text purchase orders are often higher.
E.AnalysisP2P14OptimizationPotential1: By using the Celonis App Store Analysis “Free-Text Orders” relevant KPIs like the amount of free-text orders as well as the total amount of net order value for free-text orders can be detected at a glance.
E.ShortPOItemsWithWithoutFreeTextOrder: PO Items with/ without Free-Text Order
E.ShortTotalCycleTimesWithWithoutFreeTextO: Average Cycle Times with/ without Free-Text Order
E.AnalysisP2P14ShortKPIExplanation: Free-Text Order Ratio is a Three-Way Match of PO Items w/o PRs, PO Items w/o Material No. and PO Items w/o Contract Usage
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionTitle: What are effective measures to decrease the amount of Free-Text Orders in Procurement?
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionMeasure1: Check the settings of your ERP system
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionObjective1: Reduce the opportunities to enter Free-Text Orders
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionObjective2: Ensure adherence to the best practice
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionImplementation1: Go into your ERP system and check the system for the proper set up of the purchase order creation.
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionImplementation2: In case you have not had experience with changing the setting of your ERP system, contact the responsible purchaser or IT department with the issue.
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionImplementation3: Create a guideline showing the different steps of purchase orders, either with screenshots or by recording your screen for a tutorial video.
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionImplementation4: Create a new folder as a kit for new purchasers, so that future purchasers will directly implement the best practice.
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionImplementation5: Organize brief training sessions by offering several appointments to your purchasers.
E.AnalysisP2P14TakingActionImplementation6: In these sessions, demonstrate the delivery best practice.
E.AnalysisP2P14MoreInfoPurchaseRequisition: Deeper Analysis on PO Items without Purchase Requisition
E.AnalysisP2P08Heading: Increase the use of contracts  to ensure an efficient procurement process.
E.AnalysisP2P08ChallengeText1: Too many companies have troubles with signing and monitoring their contracts efficiently, resulting in high risks of supply shortcomings.
E.AnalysisP2P08ChallengeText2: It takes a lot of effort and research for strategic pruchasing to negotiate good contracts with well established suppliers. Not using these contracts is inefficient and incompliant.
E.AnalysisP2P08PotentialText1: Normally, prices can vary depending on different suppliers or the economic situation, with the use of contracts a company can increase the predictability of prices.
E.AnalysisP2P08PotentialText2: Also, procurement transactions become more efficient as fewer approvals are necessary.
E.AnalysisP2P08PotentialText3: A further positive effect of efficient contract usage at its optimum are aggregated orders and the ability to make use of economies of scale.
E.AnalysisP2P08KPIDevelopment: Development of Contract Usage over time
E.AnalysisP2P08RootCause01: Contract Usage with and w/o PR
E.AnalysisP2P08RootCause05: Contract Usage by Average PO Value
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionTitle: Take Action to Increase Purchases via Contract Release Orders
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionMeasure3: Check running times, prices and order volumes
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionObjective1: Establish supply agreements with well-performing vendors
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionObjective2: Optimize Contract Usage and minimise cases where contracted items are being ordered as standard POs.
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionObjective4: Reduce the amount of manual non-contract orders
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionObjective5: Define contract usage targets to continuously improve your procurment process
E.AnalysisP2P08TakingActionImplementation0: Evaluate vendors regularly based on their performance and supply volume. Aim to establish supply agreements with highly valued vendors, reducing the negotiation frequency of materials and services frequently ordered.
Importantly, ensure that vendors under contract are evaluated regularly based on their performance.
Analyze purchasing history to identify cases where materials and services that have been ordered outside of contract, despite the fact one is in place with that vendor.
Analyse cases in breach of this policy, and communicate the results to the relevant procurement departments.
Purchasing outside of contract can limit the accuracy of the material master data use for production planning. Create policy that states clearly the conditions under which this is permitted.
Incentivize the implementation of electronic contract usage for large customers.
Use the Transformation Centre to continuously evaluate Contract Usage  Rates and send out reports to all procurement managers on a regular basis
E.AnalysisP2P03ChallengeText0: The ideal process would use an Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) interface for order messaging for customers with a frequency of order.
E.AnalysisP2P03ChallengeText0_1: In general, reducing or completely avoiding paper order messages for all suppliers is favorable, as it is the most expensive way of ordering.
E.AnalysisP2P03ChallengeText1: The direction of improvement is maximizing the EDI rate for purchase orders with the suppliers, especially for the suppliers that already have an EDI interface installed or to increase the rate of mail order messages.
E.AnalysisP2P03ChallengeText2: The analysis is designed to help realize savings before and after the increase of electronic order messaging.
E.AnalysisP2P03ChallengeText2_1: This can be achieved by improving the data quality of order messages and increase in cycle times due to increase of EDI rate further enabling improvement of automation rate.
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionQuestion: What are the useful measures to increase Electronic Order Messages ?
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionObjective1: Increase the suppliers’ awareness of electronic order messages
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionObjective2: Increase the employee‘s awareness of electronic order messages
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionObjective3: Classify suppliers by the number of purchase order volume and value in a matrix
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionObjective4: Set new standards for future high volume suppliers
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionImplementation1: Contact the top suppliers in terms of number of purchase orders with low or no EDI usage and convince them to install an EDI interface.
There are many cases in which the supplier may not even be aware of the impact this could have.
Send a serial letter/e-mail listing the advantages of electronic order messages.
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionImplementation2: Establish training sessions for current purchasing employees.
In these sessions, demonstrate the delivery best practice.
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionImplementation3: You should prioritize high value, high volume suppliers first, as these are the most typical vendors that use or would use an EDI interface.
Similarly, for high volume, low value suppliers, as the installation costs are offset by the large amount of time and cost savings.
For example, you could filter supplier table for suppliers with a minimum amount of orders per year, e.g. 100 purchase orders.
E.AnalysisP2P03TakingActionImplementation4: Create guidelines for new, relevant suppliers regarding a target rate of EDI usage and make them available for daily work.
Determine a responsible person for updating the guidelines and tracking the improvements.

Create a new folder as a kit for new purchasers, so that future employees will directly implement the best practice.
E.AnalysisP2P42TakingActionImplementation2: Identify and reevaluate underperforming suppliers that don't meet specified limits.
E.AnalysisP2P42TakingActionImplementation3: Put together a list of materials and material groups (e.g. catalogue orders with small purchase amounts).
Cluster the materials and identify similar or same types which can be standardized and bought from the same supplier, thereby decreasing complexity and manual errors.
E.AnalysisP2P42TakingActionImplementation4: Use Celonis to continuously evaluate cycle times and send out reports to all purchasing organizations on a regular basis.
Establish a continuous improvement process for setting purchase orders within process limits by implementing the proper KPIs.

E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText3_1: This analysis is build after the Six Sigma's Define-Measure-Analyze-Improve-Control (DMAIC) approach; In the analysis' settings you can specify process limits as well as build subsets on which process capability should be calculated.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText3_2: Use the Explorative View to determine how your process currently performs and to quantify cycle times that are out of process limits. Knowing your problems, analyze true root causes of identified issues by using the Root Causes Sheet.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText3_3: When improvements are in place, make sure that your cycle times stay within process limits by going through previous analysis steps.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText2_1: With the help of process mining, purchasing organizations can realize a more stable process.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText2_2: that meet specified process limits by making the efficiency within their procurement functions and from their suppliers transparent and suggesting measures to improve efficiency.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText2_3: Process variance for these activities provide critical information on an organization's procurement efficiency.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText1_1: With the recent focus on cost reduction, many organizations are devoting more time to identifying opportunities for long-term savings.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeText1_2: One way to cut costs is by using the six sigma approach to reduce process variability.
E.AnalysisP2P42ChallengeHeading: Combining Six Sigma Approach with Celonis Process Mining

E.ProcessControlDescription1:
Before starting the Six Sigma analysis, you have to determine whether your process is in statistical control.
Control limits are based on data and tell you how a process is actually performing on a statistical level.
E.ProcessControlDescription2: However, they don't represent customer requirement.
E.ProcessControlDescription3: The visual comparison between the control limits and the performance data allows you to detect any extraordinary variation in the process — variation that may indicate a problem or fundamental change in the process.
E.DataSubsetDescription: Determine How Your Process Currently Performs
E.DataSubsetDescription1: In the Measure Phase, the current performance of your process is determined. You refine the measurement definitions by setting the process limits and building subset on the process data.
E.DataSubsetDescription2: Based on defined measurements, the statistical study "process capability" is calculated using the Celonis Python API.
E.ImproveDescription1: The Improve Phase is where the team brainstorms solutions, pilots process changes, implements solutions and lastly, collects data to confirm there is measurable improvement
E.ImproveQuestion: How to Improve Out Of Limits
E.ControlDescription2:
Specification limits are defined by you (the user), control limits are calculated and represent the statistical control.
You can specify specification limits in the define sheet.

E.AnalysisP2P42BacklogDescriptionTitle: Why the data needs to be transformed?
E.AnalysisP2P42BacklogDescriptionText1: Process Capability calculation requires normal distribution-like data to provide meaningful results. In order to transform data to a more normal like distribution, the Box Cox transformation is used.
E.AnalysisP2P42BacklogDescriptionText2: This transformation modifies the distributional shape of a set of data to be more normally distributed so that process capability calculation which requires normality can be appropriately used.

E.P2P14UseCaseDescription01: Free-Text Orders are Purchase Orders that are not based on existing material numbers from the Vendor Master Data. Placing a Free-Text Order might be easy for the requisitioner but can also tie up additional resources.
E.P2P14UseCaseDescription02: Free-Text Orders are not standard and therefore might require more manual effort. The processing of Free-Text Orders might also require extra effort from accounts payable.
E.P2P14UseCaseDescription03: Free-Text Orders are also associated with a high ratio of callbacks and bad buys which drive process costs and strain procurement operations.
E.P2P14BenefitsDescription01: By looking at the impact of Free-Text Orders/ Non Catalogue Orders on the business process, the customer can identify the need to reduce the ratio of Free-Text Orders/ Non Catalogue Orders in their Purchase-to-Pay Process.
E.P2P14FreeTextOrdersDefinition: We define Free Text Orders as Purchaase Order Items that do not cointain the Material Number from the Material Master Table in the respective field.
E.P2P14FreeTextOrderValueDefinition: The Free Text Order Value is defined as the Net Order Value of all Purchase Order Items, which are ordered without an existing material number.
E.P2P14Teaser: Monitor and tackle the amount of Free-Text Orders in your Purchasing
E.P2P14ImpactOnCycleTimesTitle: How do Free-Text Orders influence the Total Cycle Time?

E.P2P03FocusTeaser: Why is the use of Electronic Order Messages in purchasing so important?
E.P2P03Challenge_01: Electronic Order Messages are a categorization of order message types that involve the direct communication of two individual ERP-Systems for exchanging information concerning Purchase Orders with suppliers.
E.P2P03Benefits_01: Order Messages can be transmitted in many different ways. Via Email, Print/ Mail, Fax, and EDI. Order Messages transmitted through EDI involve the least amount of disruptions to the user, the least manual effort and the least amount of processing time.
E.P2P03Benefits_02: They are also less error prone and have a positive effect on process costs in general.

E.P2P08Challenge01: In Procurement, Contract Release Orders are defined as purchase orders that are created with reference to an existing contract.
E.P2P08Challenge02: One of the goals of strategic purchasing is to negotiate supply contracts with favourable prices, discounts and fixed terms. Use this analysis to focus on how contracts are being used within your organisation.
E.P2P08Benefit: By utilising procurement contracts, businesses can increase the predictability of prices and material volume, and also hedge against future price increases for commodities or frequently purchased material.

E.P2P08RootCauseInfo03_2: Hence discerning between Catalogue and Non-Catalogue PO items when analysing contract usage provides a clearer understanding of where to focus effort to increase contrage usage.
